review_title: Great colleagues and support, questionable humanitarian practices
pros:
-Strongly committed to Evangelical Christian beliefs and ethics
-Generally kind and supportive staff and mentors at all levels
-Ample opportunity for advancement
cons:
-Can be promoted to positions that you are not qualified or adequately trained to take
-Strong disconnect between culture of HQ and most country offices
-Very tight financial and procurement policies that can hamper field agility and response times
-Leadership is generally homogeneous in demographics and approach to work
-Very arduous working hours and conditions can be given in field with RR schedules and compensation that is well below industry standards, even for faith based NGOs.
-Considered lone rangers among humanitarian implementers (often for valid reasons)
Helping on language issue and nursing
